Module Cryptography
Package cryptography

Class Affine

java.lang.Object
cryptography.Cipher
cryptography.SubstitutionCipher
cryptography.Affine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Crackable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Atbash, Cesar
public class Affine
extends SubstitutionCipher
implements Crackable
This class represents the Affine Cipher. This cipher works with the formula: C(x) = (ax - b) mod m where a and b are the cipher's keys, m is the alphabet's length and x is the position of the current character in the alphabet. C(x) is the position of the encrypted character in the alphabet.

For example, Let us say that we have an affine cipher with the following properties:
  • Alphabet: "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ" (26 letters)
  • a = 3
  • b = 6
  • m = 26
  • C(x) = (3x - 6) mod 26
We want to encrypt the letter 'm'. In the alphabet, it has the position 12 (we start counting from 0). So the position of the encrypted letter is: C(12) = (3*13 - 6) mod 26 = 16. The 16th letter in the alphabet is 'q' (again, counting from 0), so this is our encrypted message.

NOTE: This cipher only works if 'a' and 'm' are coprime. Otherwise, the encryption will yield mistakes. To safely assign a key, use the setSecureKeys(int a, int b) method.

  • Method Details

    • getKeys

      public int[] getKeys()
      Retrieves the keys of this affine cipher. The returned array consists of two elements: 'a' and 'b', which are the coefficients used to encrypt and decrypt text.
      Returns:
      An array that consists of this cipher's keys

    • getA

      public int getA()
      Returns the first key of this cipher. This is the coefficient 'a', which is used to encrypt and decrypt text.
      Returns:
      The key 'a' of this cipher

    • getB

      public int getB()
      Returns the second key of this cipher. This is the coefficient 'a', which is used to encrypt and decrypt text.
      Returns:
      The key 'b' of this cipher

    • getM

      public int getM()
      Returns the coefficient 'm' of this cipher, which is the alphabet's length. This method delegates to: getAlphabet().length().
      Returns:
      The coefficient 'm' of this cipher

    • setKeys

      @Deprecated public void setKeys​(int a, int b)
      Deprecated.
      To ensure that the coefficients 'a' and 'm' are coprime use the setSecureKeys(int a, int b) method.
      Sets the keys of this cipher. Note that if the given coefficient 'a' is not coprime with the coefficient 'm' (the alphabet's length) this cipher will yield errors.
      Parameters:
      a - The first coefficient
      b - The second coefficient

    • setSecureKeys

      public void setSecureKeys​(int a, int b) throws CipherException
      Sets the keys of this cipher.
      Parameters:
      a - The first coefficient
      b - The second coefficient
      Throws:
      CipherException - If 'a' is not coprime with the alphabet's length

    • crack

      public java.lang.String[] crack()
      Attempts to crack a message by using brute force. The array returned by this method contains all possible solutions for the encrypted message. For affine ciphers, there is a total of (m-1)*m solutions.
      Specified by:
      crack in interface Crackable
      Returns:
      An array containing all possible solutions for the message
